metadata.title: C-UAS Product Knowledge Base
metadata.description: Comprehensive knowledge base for Counter-Unmanned Aerial Systems (C-UAS) products and technologies

Roadrunner-M.carryingCapacity: Requires specialized launch platform - NOT portable for individual soldiers. Requires ground-based launcher installation with 4-person crew
Roadrunner-M.description: Revolutionary recoverable ground-based air defense interceptor. Twin-jet powered VTOL autonomous air vehicle capable of high subsonic speeds and high-G maneuvers. Features a high-explosive warhead for destroying aerial threats including UAS, cruise missiles, and low-flying aircraft. Uniquely reusable - can return to base, land vertically, refuel, and relaunch in minutes if not deployed against a target.
keyFeatures: Twin turbojet engines with thrust vectoring
Integrated with Lattice AI command and control

specifications.integration: Compatible with existing air defense architectures
specifications.weight: 280 lbs (127 kg) - complete system including warhead
specifications.carryingCapacity: Requires specialized launch platform - NOT portable for individual soldiers. Requires ground-based launcher installation with 4-person crew

operationSteps: 1. Position Roadrunner-M on the launch platform with four outriggers secured
2. Verify fuel level and warhead arming status via Lattice AI interface
3. Connect ground power unit for pre-flight diagnostics (5 minutes)
4. Enable autonomous mode and confirm target data from air defense network
5. Monitor launch sequence on control station - system will auto-orient for vertical takeoff
6. After launch, monitor via Lattice AI for target acquisition and engagement
7. If recovered, prepare landing zone and perform post-flight inspection
8. Refuel and rearm for next deployment cycle

DroneBuster.weight: 4.1 lbs (1.86 kg) with battery and antenna
DroneBuster.carryingCapacity: Single soldier can carry - designed for individual operator. Fits in tactical vest or backpack

manufacturer_contact.address: 8260 Willow Oaks Corporate Dr, Fairfax, VA 22031

DroneBuster.description: Combat-proven, handheld Counter-UAS system with more than 2,500 units deployed worldwide. Designed for soldier-level defense, it enables operators to detect, identify, and defeat hostile drones in real time. As the only American-made handheld C-sUAS with optional PNT Attack (GNSS spoofing), DroneBuster delivers unmatched tactical flexibility for U.S. and allied forces.

specifications.weight: 3.2 lbs (1.45 kg) without battery, 4.1 lbs (1.86 kg) with battery and antenna
specifications.carryingCapacity: Single soldier can carry - designed for individual operator. Fits in tactical vest or backpack

operationSteps: 1. Power on DroneBuster using the side power switch
2. Allow 30 seconds for system boot-up and sensor initialization
3. Antenna will auto-calibrate - ensure clear 360-degree line of sight
4. Select detection mode from LCD menu (Full Spectrum, Drone-Only, or Targeted)
5. Adjust sensitivity level based on environment (Urban=Low, Remote=High)
6. Monitor LCD display for threats - color coding: Green=Safe, Yellow=Possible Threat, Red=Hostile Drone
7. Upon detection, hold device steady and note direction on compass bearing
8. If GNSS attack enabled, activate spoofing mode after confirming hostile intent
9. Log all detections and times for post-operation analysis
10. Recharge battery after 6-8 hours of operation using tactical charging kit

Beast+.carryingCapacity: Single soldier can carry in load-bearing equipment or messenger bag. Compact form factor approximately the size of a military radio
Beast+.description: Dismount multi-channel receiver that builds upon the battle-proven Beast platform with the addition of a third receive channel and transmit capabilities. Supports detection, direction finding (DF), and electronic attack of adversary signals. This multi-function device performs survey, drive test, and surveillance of multiple push-to-talk and cellular protocols.

specifications.carryingCapacity: Single soldier can carry in load-bearing equipment or messenger bag. Compact form factor approximately the size of a military radio

operationSteps: 1. Insert compatible battery and power on using center button
2. Connect appropriate antenna configuration for frequency range of interest
3. Select three receive channels using touchscreen interface (Channel 1, 2, 3)
4. Set frequency range for each channel - common protocols pre-programmed
5. Enable direction finding (DF) - align antenna with target signal
6. Monitor signal strength indicators on display for triangulation
7. Engage electronic attack if authorized - select jamming profile for specific protocol
8. Use Reaper ATAK plug-in to share DF data with tactical operations center
9. Monitor demodulator output on screen - 16 simultaneous signals tracked
10. Log all signal intercepts with GPS coordinates and timestamps
11. Battery swap procedure: Turn off, replace battery, power on (takes 5 seconds)

SilentGuardian EW-300.carryingCapacity: NOT portable - requires full vehicle installation. Requires crew of 2: one operator and one system administrator

manufacturer_contact.address: 4500 Great America Pkwy, Santa Clara, CA 95054

SilentGuardian EW-300.description: Advanced vehicular-mounted electronic warfare system designed for wide-spectrum signal detection and neutralization. Features adaptive jamming algorithms and AI-driven threat analysis to counter evolving adversary communications and drone control systems in real-time.

specifications.weight: 420 lbs (190 kg) - complete system with antennas and power supply
specifications.carryingCapacity: NOT portable - requires full vehicle installation. Requires crew of 2: one operator and one system administrator

operationSteps: 1. Mount system on vehicle using provided rack-mount brackets (requires 4 crew members, 20 minutes)
2. Connect power harness to vehicle alternator/power management system
3. Install omnidirectional antenna array on vehicle roof (4 main antennas)
4. Boot up control console and perform system diagnostics (5 minutes)
5. Calibrate threat detection AI by scanning local electromagnetic environment
6. Establish communication with tactical operations center via secure link
7. Enable real-time spectrum monitoring mode - system auto-detects threats
8. Operator monitors threat display and activates jamming profiles as needed
9. For convoy movement: maintain 50-meter spacing with front scout vehicle
10. System automatically prioritizes threats using AI algorithm
11. Monitor power consumption (vehicle must run continuously during operations)
12. After mission: shutdown procedure takes 3 minutes for safe deactivation of jamming circuits

PhantomNet Disruptor.carryingCapacity: Single soldier can carry as backpack system or two soldiers can share load. Weight distributed across backpack frame
PhantomNet Disruptor.description: Man-portable electronic warfare suite combining SIGINT, direction finding, and targeted jamming capabilities. Designed for special operations and rapid deployment scenarios, providing comprehensive electromagnetic spectrum dominance in a lightweight package.

specifications.carryingCapacity: Single soldier can carry as backpack system or two soldiers can share load. Weight distributed across backpack frame

operationSteps: 1. Don backpack and secure all straps for stable carry during operations
2. Deploy antenna mast - extend to full height (approximately 2 meters) and lock
3. Power on main control unit using power button on chest pack
4. Wait for system boot and GPS lock (approximately 45 seconds)
5. Select mission mode on touch screen: SIGINT mode or Direction Finding mode
6. Enable dual-band simultaneous operation if tracking multiple frequencies
7. Calibrate heading using compass heading input or auto-calibrate with GPS
8. For direction finding: rotate slowly 360 degrees while monitoring DF display
9. Peak signal strength indicates direction to target - note bearing
10. Encrypt all data links and establish Blue Force Tracker connection
11. Transmit DF results and SIGINT findings to tactical operations center
12. Battery status monitored continuously - prepare for battery swap at 20% capacity
13. To pack down: retract antenna, place in transport bag, secure backpack straps

Wavebreaker Pro.carryingCapacity: NOT portable - requires stationary installation. Needs 2-3 personnel for initial setup, then minimal 1-person operation afterward
Wavebreaker Pro.description: Compact counter-drone and communications jamming system optimized for fixed-site protection of critical infrastructure. Employs intelligent frequency hopping detection and selective jamming to minimize collateral interference while maximizing threat neutralization.

specifications.weight: 340 lbs (154 kg) - complete fixed installation with all components
specifications.carryingCapacity: NOT portable - requires stationary installation. Needs 2-3 personnel for initial setup, then minimal 1-person operation afterward

operationSteps: 1. Position system at fixed-site location with clear 360-degree RF exposure
2. Install weatherproof enclosure on mounting pole or building structure
3. Mount antenna array with clear line of sight to coverage area (typically 2.5 km radius)
4. Connect power (110/220V AC) and establish backup battery power (UPS system)
5. Connect secure network link to command center for remote access
6. Initialize system - automatic frequency sweep takes 10 minutes
7. Configure threat detection parameters: drone signatures loaded, frequency bands set
8. Enable selective jamming mode - system learns friendly communications patterns
9. Set automatic threat prioritization - 30 targets can be tracked simultaneously
10. Remote operators access via secure web interface from command center
11. System continuously monitors specified frequency bands 24/7
12. Upon threat detection: system automatically engages jamming if authorized
13. Log all events with timestamps for post-incident analysis
14. Maintenance: Check antenna connections monthly, clean RF windows seasonally
limitations: Limited range compared to mobile systems

SpectrumHawk X7.carryingCapacity: NOT portable on foot - pod must be installed on helicopter/UAV airframe. Requires aircraft maintenance crew of 4 for installation (30 minutes)
SpectrumHawk X7.description: Next-generation airborne electronic warfare pod designed for helicopter and UAV integration. Provides persistent area denial against hostile drones, communications, and radar systems with software-defined radio architecture for rapid mission reconfiguration.

specifications.weight: 45 lbs (pod configuration, 20.4 kg); 15 lbs (10 kg) for control unit
specifications.carryingCapacity: NOT portable on foot - pod must be installed on helicopter/UAV airframe. Requires aircraft maintenance crew of 4 for installation (30 minutes)

operationSteps: 1. Schedule maintenance crew to mount pod on helicopter hardpoint (2 main attachment points)
2. Install pod securely and perform pre-flight structural verification
3. Connect power umbilical from aircraft electrical system to pod
4. Load mission software profile via ground control station (GCS) - takes 5 minutes
5. Perform pod diagnostic tests - self-test procedures run automatically
6. Brief pilot on operational altitude and tactical area boundaries
7. During flight: activate pod sensors at cruise altitude for signal detection
8. Mission controller at GCS operates pod and directs aircraft for optimal coverage
9. Software-defined radio core enables real-time mission reconfiguration in flight
10. Dual redundant systems ensure operation if one channel fails
11. Tactical mesh network integration allows data sharing with ground units
12. Deploy jamming waveforms as authorized by tactical commander
13. Log all actions for post-mission analysis and threat assessments
14. After landing: secure pod power and transmit data via secure link to command center

StormShield Mobile EW Suite.carryingCapacity: NOT portable - requires vehicle platform (typically HMMWV or larger). Requires 3-4 personnel for installation (45 minutes), then 2-person crew during operations
StormShield Mobile EW Suite.description: Ruggedized all-in-one electronic warfare platform built for convoy protection and mobile operations. Combines signals intelligence, electronic attack, and cyber-electronic warfare capabilities in a vehicle-integrated system with autonomous threat response.

specifications.weight: 580 lbs (263 kg) - complete integrated system with all components
specifications.carryingCapacity: NOT portable - requires vehicle platform (typically HMMWV or larger). Requires 3-4 personnel for installation (45 minutes), then 2-person crew during operations

operationSteps: 1. Select vehicle platform - must be HMMWV or equivalent with power generation capacity
2. Perform vehicle integration: install rack-mount system in vehicle bed or cargo area
3. Connect integrated cooling system - ensure heat dissipation pathway is clear
4. Establish electrical connections to vehicle power (requires 100A circuit)
5. Install multi-function phased array antennas on vehicle roof using reinforced mounts
6. Boot up main control console and run diagnostics (10 minutes)
7. Perform full-spectrum calibration - system scans all frequencies from 10 MHz to 40 GHz
8. Operator #1 monitors threat detection display; Operator #2 manages network and cyber-EW
9. Enable autonomous threat response - system will automatically engage threats if authorized
10. For convoy movement: position system with 100-meter spacing from other vehicles
11. Continuous monitoring of electromagnetic spectrum with 1000W jamming output available
12. Network-centric warfare integration: shares data with command center in real-time
13. Cyber-EW capabilities: can disrupt enemy network communications if authorized
14. System requires continuous vehicle operation - fuel consumption approximately 15 GPH
15. Mission completion: safe shutdown of all jamming circuits (5 minutes) before vehicle movement
